name: Walter Michelin
tagline: Computer Science Student at The College of New Jersey
body:
Walter Michelin
(732)-597-0253  Michelw2@tcnj.edu
440 Ship Ave, Beachwood, New Jersey
waltermichelin.com
	
EDUCATION	

The College of New Jersey, Ewing, New Jersey		
			Major: Computer Science, Class of 2015
			Relevant Course Work: Software Engineering, Data Structures
			Ocean County College, Toms River, New Jersey
			Associates in Business Administration, May 2013
			Distinctions: Graduated Cum Laude, Dean’s List
	
EXPERIENCE 	

Saker ShopRites Incorporated							
			Bookkeeper    		    		   Toms River, NJ                    	          Aug’11- Jan’14
•	Managed storewide cash inflow. 
•	Coordinated reconciliation of store register accounts.
•	Promoted from cashier within one month of employment.
			The College of New Jersey				     	      
			Access Services Representative	  Ewing, NJ	             	          Aug’13-Present
•	Responsible for handling student accounts.
•	Coordinate and handle circulation of various library materials.

PROJECTS		

Students Organizing Against Pollution 	                   
			Develop a webapp for Habitat for Humanity 		          	           Jan’14-Present
•	Collaborate and work directly in small team oriented groups to better learn and understand the issues at hand working with Habitat for Humanity. 
•	Develop and implement various features of the SOAP web application. 
•	Work under the supervision of Dr. Pulimood to learn and implement software engineering concepts and fundamentals. 
			

Reddit Trends
Implement an application to understand trending reddit topics	           Jan’14-Present
•	In Python, create an application to communicate with both the Reddit and Twitter APIs to gather massive amounts of data from reddit.com, organize and analyze said data and present it in a digestible format on twitter.com.
•	Learn and better understand the Python language and take advantage of its excellent API support and design capabilities. 

ACTIVITIES 	

Association For Computing Machinery 	        			          Aug’13-Present
•	Planning and coordination of Hack TCNJ.
•	Competed in various hackathons against thousands of peers.
•	Collaborate with other members to learn new and relevant coding skills.


TCNJ Men’s Club Lacrosse						          Aug’13-Present
•	Starting Defenseman.
•	Organization and planning of team activities.
•	Teamwork, leadership, and recruitment.

SKILLS	           	

Programming Languages: Python, Java, C++, Objective-C.
			Software: Linux, Mac OSX, Windows, Microsoft Office. 
Interests: Coding, Constructing custom PCs for friends and family, Lacrosse, Hiking, 		Golf, Skiing.
